oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Cemetery wall at Cragfont
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Detail view of the stone cemetery wall, capstone elements, and steps at Cragfont. The vegetation in the area is overgrown.

The late Georgian style home was built between 1798 and 1802, and was originally home of General James Winchester. It was named after the Rocky Bluff it is located on. Cragfont was occupied by the Winchester family until 1864. The family cemetery is located at the rear of the home, and General Winchester is buried at it.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jones, Lester
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cemeteries--Tennessee
Stone walls; Cemeteries; Masonry
